senses.de: As much as needed or necessary.
senses.ex: He didn't have sufficient money to buy a new car.

Tips.title: Quantity Focus
Tips.description: Used when stressing the quantity needed to fulfill a requirement or condition.
Tips.example: Do we have sufficient chairs for the meeting?

Tips.title: Conditional Success
Tips.description: Indicates the minimum needed for a task to be completed successfully.
Tips.example: There's sufficient evidence to start the trial.

Tips.title: Subjectivity
Tips.description: What counts as sufficient can vary depending on a person's judgment or context.
Tips.example: What's sufficient rest varies from person to person.

senses.ex: She is sufficient in handling the team.

Tips.title: Skill Level
Tips.description: Refers to having the necessary skills or ability to do something properly.
Tips.example: Her expertise was sufficient for the advanced course.

Tips.title: Meeting Standards
Tips.description: Suggests a person meets the basic standards required for a task or job.
Tips.example: His qualifications are sufficient for entry-level work.

Tips.title: Minimum Requirement
Tips.description: Describes the lowest level of competency needed to be considered able.
Tips.example: She showed sufficient understanding to pass the test.

Adequate.wordDefinition:
The words adequate and sufficient both mean that something is enough or satisfactory.

However, adequate means that something is satisfactory but not necessarily more than that. For example, if you have an adequate amount of food, you have enough to eat but not an excess.

Adequate refers to having enough, while sufficient refers to having not only enough but also the right amount or quality to meet one's needs.

Ample.wordDefinition:
Ample means there is more than enough of something. For example, "there is an ample supply of food for everyone" means that there is plenty of food to go around.

Sufficient means that there is enough of something to meet a particular need or requirement. For example, "the amount of money we have saved is sufficient for our vacation" means that the money they saved will be enough to cover their costs.

Ample implies an excess or abundance whereas sufficient implies just enough to meet a specific requirement.

Competent.wordDefinition:
Competent means having or showing the necessary skills and abilities to do something well. It is applicable when referring to someone's skills, knowledge, or experience in a particular area.

For example, a competent doctor should have the necessary skills and knowledge to diagnose and treat patients, while a sufficient amount of medicine should be available to treat all of the patients.

Decent.wordDefinition:
Decent means something is good or adequate, but not necessarily great or excellent.

It describes something that is respectable or satisfactory. For example, a decent meal means the meal you had was good enough, but not necessarily fantastic.

To summarize, decent refers to the quality of something and sufficient refers to the quantity or amount of something.

Enough.wordDefinition:
Both enough and sufficient refer to having or providing an adequate amount of something.

However, enough is a more common and informal word, while sufficient is more formal and often used in professional or academic settings.

Enough suggests a basic or satisfactory amount, while sufficient implies an amount that is necessary or appropriate for a specific purpose or situation.

In everyday conversation, it is perfectly fine to use enough, but when writing a report or giving a presentation, sufficient might be a more appropriate word to use.

Satisfactory.wordDefinition:
Satisfactory means something meets expectations or requirements, while sufficient means there is enough of something.

For example, if someone says their performance on a test was satisfactory, it means they did well enough to meet the expectations or requirements set for the test.

Satisfactory is applicable when talking about meeting expectations or requirements, while sufficient is applicable when talking about having enough of something.

Substantial.wordDefinition:
Substantial means significant in amount or size, while sufficient means enough for a particular purpose.

For example, if you have a substantial amount of money, it means you have a large amount of money. If you have sufficient money to buy groceries, it means you have enough money to buy what you need.

Substantial refers to a large or significant amount, while sufficient refers to enough for a specific purpose.

Suitable.wordDefinition:
Suitable means appropriate or fitting for a particular purpose or situation.

For example, if you're looking for a job, you might want to find one that is suitable for your skills and experience. This means finding a job that matches your qualifications and would allow you to perform well.

The words sufficient and suitable both refer to having enough of something, but sufficient refers to quantity, while suitable refers to quality or appropriateness.

The lack of red blood cells means that muscles don't get enough oxygen, the reduced number of platelets is not sufficient to repair wounds, and the dearth of functional white blood cells impairs the immune system, increasing the risk of infections. To restore the normal function of the blood, leukemic cells have to be eliminated.

quotes.Text: I always say I've given 24 insufficient performances and I'm looking forward to the time in my life when I'll do something that I think is good. There's always stuff you can do better, stuff that maybe you didn't uncover enough. But if you do something that you truly believe is perfect, then that's got to be the last movie you do.
quotes.Title: Australian Actor
quotes.Name: Russell Crowe

quotes.Text: Changing laws and changing the political dialogue, while necessary, is insufficient to ensure that bullying stops; to ensure that every young person is supported by their parents and their teachers as they question who they are and they discover who they are regardless of the sexuality.
quotes.Title: American Celebrity
quotes.Name: Chelsea Clinton

quotes.Text: The man who has sufficient power over himself to wait until his nature has recovered its even balance is the truly wise man, but such beings are seldom met with.
quotes.Title: Italian Celebrity
quotes.Name: Giacomo Casanova

quotes.Text: The heart is a small thing, but desireth great matters. It is not sufficient for a kite's dinner, yet the whole world is not sufficient for it.
quotes.Title: English Poet
quotes.Name: Francis Quarles

quotes.Text: By believing passionately in something that still does not exist, we create it. The nonexistent is whatever we have not sufficiently desired.
quotes.Title: Novelist
quotes.Name: Franz Kafka

quotes.Text: In Republics, the great danger is, that the majority may not sufficiently respect the rights of the minority.
quotes.Title: American President
quotes.Name: James Madison

quotes.Text: I have thought a sufficient measure of civilization is the influence of good women.
quotes.Title: American Philosopher
quotes.Name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.Text: A change in the weather is sufficient to recreate the world and ourselves.
quotes.Title: French Author
quotes.Name: Marcel Proust

quotes.Text: I'm sufficiently complex that there's no one truth about me.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Mike Cernovich

quotes.Text: Power is not sufficient evidence of truth.
quotes.Title: English Writer
quotes.Name: Samuel Johnson
